Comment.value: very first time PC levels up

value.0: "Already you have started back up the road to success. As you grow in power, so too do I." Your weapons sounds a triumphant if slightly off-key fanfare in your mind.
"As this is the first time you have increased in power, I shall draw upon your energies to increase my effectiveness as a fighting weapon."

Comment.value: give the weapon an increase of +1/+1 enhancement

value.0: "After this, I shall allow you to choose effects that you would like to add to me."

Comment.value: every time pc levels up, except for the first.

value.0: "Very good. Things are coming along quite nicely. Soon you shall have regained the power you once had. Now, how would you instruct me to grow in power?"
"Now why do you have to go and waste my time like that? You should be drawing as much power as possible, not as little as possible."
"Very good. Now, what kind of awesome powers would you like me to attain?"
"That's what everybody wants. What do you want me to do?"
"That... does not sound very warlike. How am I to become a legendary power if you use me like a potion? Ah, well, fine."
"Well I hope you are happy. I, on the other hand, am not!"
"Checking the essence available in your body, I can add one of these powers."
"Sometimes you are a little odd, but I like you anyways."

"Well, I hope you are happy. I certainly am!"
"What kind of damage were you thinking?"

value.0: "It shall be done."

Comment.value: add +1 to hit and damage on mw

value.0: "Always nice when you can actually hit your opponent, is it not? Of course it is!"
"That will depend on how powerful you have grown. The stronger you are, the stronger I can get. Generally I can be enhanced in several ways."
"My ability to hit and do damage will only go up occasionally, I can have bonus types of damage added, I can do special effects when I hit something, and I can have a few special abilities."
"Just choose the category of enhancement you would like and then choose a specific effect."

Comment.value: When PC first begins game play, after cutscene, Glowing lights

value.0: "So, you do live. Good. I was starting to worry there." You try to find the source of the mysterious voice. It seems to be echoing from the glowing lights.
"You were dead. I brought you back. Now we have to get you inside the keep where you'll be safe."
"It has fallen upon dark times. Many of its guard were killed in their battle against the Masked Man's army. Even some of its leaders lie dead but at least the gates still stand."
"Once the Masked Man's forces can be rooted out and destroyed, you'll discover the path to power. We have plans for you, but enough about that for now. You need to get going."
"I am sure that seems like it must be important, but trust me, right now it is not. We are on a rather short time frame here and we must get you into that keep, preferably with a little fanfare."
"Of course, first we are going to have to do something about the state of your companions. And you will need a weapon, but that's my job."
"I also imagine that the fog of death has clouded your memory a bit, but don't waste my time with petty, unimportant questions. What do you absolutely need to know?"
"Their bodies were likely looted by the retreating forces and scattered about the Battlefield. With nightfall upon us, I imagine the rats are probably gnawing on their bones as we speak."
"And beat off the rats with your fists? How about you choose what kind of weapon you would like me to transform into first?"
<StartAction>[Sigh]</Start> "I realize you want to know, but there is not much I am allowed to tell you. The most I can say is that you have a powerful friend who wants you alive."
"My master told me to come to you, bring you back to life, and make myself useful to you. So that is what I did and am doing. I am going to transform myself into a weapon for you."
"That is one of the things I am definitely not allowed to tell you... yet. All will be revealed in time, but it is more important for us to get into the keep as soon as possible."
"Why would I expend so much energy bringing you back to life when you were already dead? Do not be so foolish. You don't have to trust me implicitly, but neither do I really trust you."
"Unfortunately, you are all I have to work with, and I am all you have left. Now are you ready for a weapon?"
"Well, I have always rather fancied myself as an elaborate sword of some kind, but, given the urgency of the situation, I'm willing to compromise. The form is entirely up to you."
"Obviously if you aren't partial to swords, I will become a weapon you are more accustomed to using. What kind of weapon do you prefer?"
"The mighty hunter who strikes from a distance; a sure shot with remarkable accuracy, of course! What kind of power do your arms seek to hold?"
"Bah! Maybe I should just become a hamster and cower inside your pocket! <StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Interesting. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Our arrows shall punch their way through enemy armor with the greatest ease! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Interesting. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Our bolts shall punch their way through enemy armor with the greatest ease! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Keep your enemy at a distance and strike <him/her> down before they reach you? An excellent plan. What kind did you have in mind?"
"It seems a little... undignified, but if that is what you wish... Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"The chosen weapon of Mistress Death. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Just imagine the fear in the eyes of our enemies when they see me in your hands! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Something unusual, to frighten our enemies and throw them into confusion? Perfect. What exactly did you have in mind?"
"An... unusual choice. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"A little better than a dagger, I suppose. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"An... Unusual choice. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"A powerful weapon to battle a powerful foe! Are you thinking of a mace, an axe, or a sword?"
"A powerful, glorious weapon! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Just imagine the fear in the eyes of our enemies when they see me in your hands! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"I can feel the crushing of the bone and the splattering of blood and brains already! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"There is something about a large steel ball crashing into a skull that is vaguely satisfying. Is that what you would like, or did you have something else in mind?"
"An often overlooked weapon, but deadly effective, if I might say so myself. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"I can feel the crushing of the bone and the splattering of blood and brains already! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"I can feel the crushing of the bone and the splattering of blood and brains already! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
Which type of hammer? A light hammer or a warhammer?
"I can feel the crushing of the bone and the splattering of blood and brains already! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"I suppose speed must count for something over brute force. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"A heavy flail or a light flail?"
"I suppose speed must count for something over brute force. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"I can feel the crushing of the bone and the splattering of blood and brains already! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Gods grant me patience with halfwits! I hope you aren't just some common thug! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Ah, yes, I can see that we have something in common. The magical talking sword: a legend, a myth, now about to become reality. Let's be specific though, which do you prefer?"
"Ah... getting fancy are we? All right, what kind?"
"Thrust, parry, slash, stab! We shall dazzle them with our quick blocks and vicious strikes. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"The weapon of mystical legends from the far east? Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Argh... and shall we talk like pirates too? Hmm, no I think not. A scimitar? Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"I suppose there must be some sort of significance in becoming insignificant; but damned if I know what it is! But it is your choice. Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"I shall be the most uncommon example of the most common weapon! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"A powerful, glorious weapon! Very well, I shall assume that form for you quite happily."
"What depths we must stoop to. I will have you know that once I was proud and powerful. <StartAction>[Sigh]</Start> Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Magnificent! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Ah, I can picture it now, a grand battle axe, striking death to our enemies! But maybe that is not what you are picturing; we should be more specific. Exactly what kind do you like?"
"Well, it is best you choose wisely. What type of weapon do you want?"
"Just imagine the fear in the eyes of our enemies when they see me in your hand! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Why am I always called upon to make such sacrifices? The Gods must want to humble me! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."

Comment.value:
Assume +1 version of chosen weapon. 
The weapon should also have light and a special ability to intiate conversation. 
Any time the pc uses the special power, the weapon should spawn in an invisible creature, put the magic sparks effect on the pc (or something similar) and initiate dialogue. 
The ability should only work when the pc is not in combat. If the pc is in combat have floaty text say "You cannot use this ability while in combat."

value.0: "Our enemies shall cower before us! Very well, I shall assume that form for you."
"Are you happy with your choice?"

Comment.value: Take away all weapons

value.0: "Fine then choose again, and make sure this time. I hate having to change forms."

Comment.value: Weapon spawned in.

value.0: "Good, then let's carry on. Are there any other questions before I tell you what you must do next?"
"You will have to kill or drive off the rats that have been gathering here. I can sense them digesting the flesh of your companions."
"Once you have killed them, we will speak again. Remember, you were becoming quite powerful before your untimely death, but you were dead so long, I had to steal from your life to bring you back..."

"If you want to regain that power, you must get to the keep quickly... But scavenge some clothes while you're at it. It simply won't do to have people spy their future leader running about in <his/her> undergarments. A bad first impression, to be sure..."
"Wealth, fame, love, oh... and your life back, if you count that as precious at all."
"I guess the process of bringing you back really did cloud your mind. I am sure your companions can fill you in on the details once you raise them."

"All I can say is that you were pursuing the Masked Man and this battlefield is where you finally caught up with him. It's a good thing you did, though things admittedly could have turned out a little better."
"I cannot explain fully right now, perhaps in time, once we trust each other more."
"For now I have enough energy to change myself into a magic weapon for you and then bring back a couple of your companions."

"You were pursuing your enemy, the Masked Man, and caught up to him as he lay siege to the Keep of Cyan. You died in the chaos, but luckily I resurrected you. I am afraid you lost a lot of life energy when I did it."
"Thanks to you, the Masked Man's forces have been scattered, at least for now. But we need to get you into the keep where you'll be safe. That's about the best summary I can give you."
"Which part of 'petty, unimportant questions' didn't you understand? I am here to give you the power and instruction you need to be someone important."
"And if that's not enough motivation for you, you'll probably be covered in wealth and fame in the process. Being a warrior, I suspect that ought to spark your attention."
"And if that's not enough motivation for you, you'll probably get to test your faith in all sorts of ways. Being a holy<man/woman>, I suspect that ought to spark your attention."
"And if that's not enough motivation for you, keep in mind that the Masked Man's forces will also ravage the local wildlife. Being a druid, I suspect that ought to spark your attention."
"And who knows what kind of knowledge you will discover in the process. Being an arcane <lad/lass>, I suspect that ought to spark your attention."
"And if that's not enough motivation for you, you'll probably get famous in the process. Being a bard, I suspect that ought to spark your attention."
"And if that's not enough motivation for you, you'll probably get rich in the process. Being a roguish <lad/lass>, I suspect that ought to spark your attention."
"But people's lives are at stake now, so you need to make some decisions."

Comment.value: After the rats are dead, before Calibast is summoned.

value.0: "Feel the energy that comes with the kill. You were an expert at this, remember? Death is one of your many callings. One you excel at." You are disconcerted by how at home the voice is becoming in your mind.
"Like a reflex, the instinct comes naturally to you. Remember."
"Now, I shall raise the spirits of your dead companions but, for each one I save, one must be sacrificed. You must speak to them and decide whom you will take and whom you will banish."

Comment.value: Summon "spirit" form of Calibast.

value.0: "Good, the spirits of your companions can be found where their corpses lay. Speak to them... And remember what I said about scavenging some clothing; Your companions may be ill-equipped, so I recommend finding them some weapons before we proceed."
"Their souls shall be bartered to Mistress Death in exchange for the lives of those who remain. Life and death hold many mysteries and there is much to be learned from them."
"You will need all the help you can get. For now, take them with you. You can always leave them behind once you're within the safety of the keep."
"However, you might find that you learn more and discover more with friends to assist you and watch your back. Still, that choice is yours, as is this. Two must die that two may live."
"No! You must make the decisions, and you must tell those whom you are condemning about your choice. There is much to learn when one has power over life and death."
"That is up to you. Choose ones that complement your abilities and make up for your weaknesses. Choose whomever you like the best. Pick them at random. Your choice."
"But you must make the decisions, and you must tell those whom you are condemning about your choice. There is much to learn when one has power over life and death."
"You may speak to them all first before making a choice, but do try to hurry. It is not a safe night to spend outside the keep's walls."

Comment.value: after the election process is started, once Enivid leaves. Should give Alias enough time to reach the pc.

value.0: "Now things are proceeding in most excellent fashion. Keep up the good work and you shall become one of the most powerful people in all of Valratha." Your weapon's voice seems most pleased with you...
"I know you must have questions, but I am only allowed to tell you a little. I will tell you the most important thing right now, though."
"All of the clues to answer your questions lie within the keep, or in the caves nearby."
"Good idea. Let us see what you can find out here."
"I am doing my best within the limits set for me. We all have a role to play. Just do your best."
"Protect the keep. Become its <Lord/Lady>. Destroy the Masked Man's forces before they can regroup. I know you probably do not trust me yet, but I am on your side."
"I might give you a hint, once in a while, but for the most part, you will need to exercise that brain of yours. I know you have one, hidden somewhere in that thick skull."

Comment.value: on way out of Yenna's tower, if PC knows about his/her background

value.0: "I hope you found that informative. I did not even know about this Garrot, but I will bet he has some interesting information to give you." You hadn't even noticed your weapon's voice slip into your mind.
"I wish she would have confided more in me. Ah, well, we will talk again after you have spoken to him."

Comment.value: after PC speaks with Garrot and gets info about the "mysterious lady"

value.0: "So that is how she was so confident you would come. I guess that explains things. What questions do you have for me?"
"Power, survival, and some degree of love. Strange, twisted love, granted... but we cannot all be perfect."
"She loves her own life, I think she still holds some love for me and I even think she loves you, in her own way."
"She has been plotting this for some time and you have always been instrumental in her success. She cannot help but love you, at least a little."
"Not as much as she would like. We are both her tools, but we still have free will. I will do my best to keep you alive, even if it comes to a point where she decides I should not."
"She has her agenda, but I have my own too. You were always my favorite, after all... Oh, I wish I could explain more, but I really cannot. Not yet."
"I still cannot reveal that, though you are getting close to the truth. I do not believe it should be long now before much more is revealed. I will tell you that she is related to you."
"Do not ask anything more than that. I should not even have said that, but I want you to trust me."
"Good idea. You are getting closer all the time."

Comment.value:
This should start when the pc finds the secret door, before going through it.
give 200 xp

value.0: [LEGACY TEXT. ALWAYS RETURN FALSE] "Good, you found the passage. Now go through quickly, for there is little time to spare. The keep will fall if you do not hurry."
"Good luck!"
"You are not keeping up here, <FirstName>. One would think a hero would have a slightly better memory."
"A man named Dylan will meet you inside the keep, though he does not know it yet. Just make sure you go with him. It is very important."
"It is an ancient tunnel that was originally made so that the city could be evacuated in an emergency. Nobody knows about it now though. They all think it is just a part of the sewers."
"Will you quit asking questions to try to discover my identity? I cannot tell you anymore about that, so just stop."
"That will be one of your tasks to find out. Right now the army attacking the keep is being led by an underling, for no ogre could organize such a massive assault."

Comment.value: when the pc has left the caves, before meeting the hermit.

value.0: "I have been talking to this hermit up ahead. His wits are addled, but he can still tell you how to get into the keep. There is no way you will make it in the front gates."
"Here are the gates. Approach them and  it should be clear what you need to do. My master shall influence events so that a young guard named Dylan grants you entrance. Do as he says."
"Good. A few of the Masked Man's forces still linger here. Drive them off so the night's watch can open the gates to you in safety."

"I am telling you the truth. I do not have all the answers and I cannot explain everything right now. To be honest, our plan's still only half-baked as it is. As you grow in power, I shall reveal more."
"You must be slow in the head! I cannot tell you that, for now. In time all shall be made clear. Just be happy you have someone to keep you alive now."

Comment.value: in the illithid caves, maybe just before the pc goes down to the second level.

value.0: "I... I think it is time for more to be revealed. I want to tell you about myself." The magic weapon seems suddenly hesitant. Vulnerable...

"Later? How much time do you think we have left? Bah, go on. Rush into this without all the information. Do not come crying to me when the Masked Man rips your brain from your head! ...No, that isn't fair of me. It's important that you hear this, whether you desire it or no..."

"You do not... Bah, go on. Rush into this without all the information. Do not come crying to me when the Masked Man rips your brain from your head! ...No, that isn't fair of me. It's important that you hear this, whether you desire it or no..."
"I was once a demon hunter. I was a man of power, sought out by rulers and zealots across the continent. I was strong in my beliefs, a man of pure heart and purpose."
"Then I met your grandmother. I fell in love and we were married. She eventually became pregnant and gave birth to your father."
"That's right, <FullName>; I am your grandfather! And I want you to know that I am proud of you. You have..."
Suddenly his voice stops, as if his presence has been ripped from your mind.
"So, my grandchild, you are everything I ever hoped for... I think it is time you saw me in the flesh, as it were..." The magic weapon's voice echoes sadly in your mind.
Your magic weapon melts in your hand, the resulting vapors coalescing into the form of a <race> man before you. He stands erect and proud, a bittersweet smile upon his face.
"There, that's better isn't it? And don't worry about your friends. They are still alive, just unconscious for a while. I thought it better if we could talk in private."
Your grandfather glances at the Masked Man's glistening corpse. "Will you not pay last respects to your fallen brother?"

"Ours is an... interesting family tree, my child. To be fair, I always loved you best... As for your grandmother, it was always strength that she demanded above all... Your father once had a brother, too, you know."
"But you do know her, <FirstName>, at least in one of her many forms. As always, there is more to that woman than meets the eye. Trust me, I learned it the hard way."
"Yes, there is much in her to like, even for an old demon hunter like me. I look forward to us being a family together again. It's been a long time..."
"Yes, that much is true and more besides. But family is family and I have seen much good in her, too. Even when I least expect it, it shines through..."

"Come, our business is done here. I will become your weapon again for the journey. Your grandmother waits for us in the Guildhall, <FirstName>, and will be eager to see you sit the throne. There is much afoot and more dark days still to come."

"Yes, that's why she lured you both here to Cyan. And when Yenna interfered and killed you both, she brought you back so this could be settled free from outside meddling... She'll be very proud of you, <FirstName>."
"You were born in dark times and those times still grow darker by the hour. I died my death many years before that day, though bonded to your grandmother, I remained."
"When your parents were killed, she fled with you pressed tight against her breast, her wings beating through the night."
"Your grandmother is a... a complex woman, <FirstName>, but let it not be said that she doesn't love you fiercely like a dire wolf her pups."
"I was born in the southern highlands and raised with a weapon in my hand. My clan, for all races in the highlands belong to a clan, worshipped a demon called Gishtara."
"One day our shaman held a special ordeal, summoning the demon to support his worshippers. The shaman lost control of his abomination, and it turned on my people."
"I was one of the few survivors. I dragged my body to a neighboring clan, holding my intestines in with one hand, pulling myself forward with my other."
"Indeed. I dedicated my life to the destruction of all demons and their spawn."
"Yes. I have enjoyed every moment I have spent with you. It is almost as good as being alive again. Even better, in some ways. I don't have to worry about myself getting killed anymore."
"Not yet. Someday I might wish to make the journey to the next world, but for now, I like what we are doing together. And there is much to do - I think we have quite the future in store, you and I."

Comment.value: this can only be selected if the present bonus on the weapon is 1/2 or less of the player's total level. So for a +3 to hit, the pc must be 6th level or better.

value.0: "I want a general +1 enhancement."
"What powers can I choose?"
"What is happening?"
"What is happening at the keep?"
"What plans?"
"Who is *we*?"
"What are you?"
"Who are you?"
"You said something about a weapon."
"Where are my companions?"
"We must go to them now!"
"I want to ask questions about you."
"Who is your master?"
"How do I know I can trust you?"
"What kind of weapon?"
"Ranged."
"Sling."
"Shortbow."
"Longbow."
"Light Crossbow."
"Heavy Crossbow."
"Polearms."
"Spear."
"Scythe."
"Halberd."
"Exotic."
"Sickle."
"Kukri."
"Kama."
"Double."
"Two-bladed Sword."
"Double Axe."
"Dire Mace."
"Blunts."
"Quarterstaff."
"Morningstar."
"Mace."
"Hammer."
"Warhammer."
"Light Hammer"
"Flail."
"Light Flail."
"Heavy Flail."
"Club."
"Blades."
"Specialty."
"Rapier."
"Katana."
"Scimitar."
"Short Sword."
"Long Sword."
"Great Sword."
"Dagger."
"Bastard Sword."
"Axes."
"I changed my mind."
"Battle Axe."
"One-handed Axe."
"Great Axe."
"No."
"Yes."
"What do I do now?"
"What do I get out of this?"
"What was I doing on this battlefield?"
"What do you mean, transform?"
"I want to know what is going on."
"Why me?"
"Very well, I am ready."
"What happens to the ones I banish?"
"What if I don't want anyone?"
"Can you choose for me?"
"But how do I choose?"
"Let's get going then."
"If you aren't going to be any help, then leave me alone."
"So what is my ultimate goal here?"
"So I have to figure this out on my own?"
"Why is she doing all of this?"
"Love?"
"How much power does she have over me?"
"Who is she?"
"Let's get going."
"I'm ready to go."
"How will I know where to go in the keep?"
"Why does this hermit have a secret tunnel to the keep?"
"How do you know about it?"
"Who is attacking the keep?"
"I am ready to go."
"You are going to have to tell me the truth sometime."
"Who is your master?"
"Not right now. Tell me later."
"I don't want to hear it."
"Tell me."
"Come, it's time we returned to the keep."
"My brother?"
"Who cares about a grandma I don't even know? Let's go."
"I think I'm beginning to like her..."
"She seems evil and vile!"
"Only the strong survive..."
"Do you remember anything of my past?"
"Wings?"
"Tell me about yourself, grandfather."
"That's why you became a demon hunter."
"Did you like being my weapon?"
"Would you like to be free?"
